subject: Golf
Tumors
Brain
Cancer
lead_paragraph: Seve Ballesteros had a third operation for a cancerous brain tumor Friday, a six-and-a-half-hour procedure that went “better than expected.” Doctors removed the rest of the tumor and reduced brain swelling. Ballesteros, 51, was in stable condition in the intensive care unit at La Paz Hospital in Madrid. Doctors wanted to relieve pressure and remove remaining parts of the malignant tumor in a deep part of the brain. ¶Five months after his second heart transplant, Erik Compton shot a four-under-par 68 at Crandon Golf Club in Key Biscayne, Fla., advancing to the second stage of the PGA Tour’s qualifying tournament. Compton finished tied with six others for 23rd, taking the final qualifying spot. heart.
